definitions.definition: To provide cover from damage or harassment; to shield; to protect.

definitions.example: During the rainstorm, we sheltered under a tree.

definitions.definition: Protected, as from wind or weather.
definitions.example: The boat was much safer, during the storm, in the sheltered cove.

definitions.definition: (Of a person) who grew up being overprotected by parents or other guardians; often implies a lack of social skills, worldly experience, etc.
